text: Marcgravia crassiflora is a species of flowering plant in the Marcgraviaceae family. It is endemic to Ecuador. ==Ecology== The plant's natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist montane areas of the Andes local ranges. The green-crowned brilliant hummingbird feeds at the large inflorescences of the Marcgravia crassiflora vines. ==References== crassiflora Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Flora of the Andes Category:Data deficient plants Category:Bird food plants Category:Vines Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Marcgravia crassiflora
